p: TEM‐EDS spectrum and mapping images (Figure S5, Supporting Information) reveal that the molar ratio of Na:Cu:Fe:Mn in the as‐prepared oxide is 0.76:0.22:0.30:0.48, and the elements are homogenously distributed in a single nanograin. The inductively coupled plasma (ICP) analysis further ascertains that the Na/Cu/Fe/Mn molar ratio is in good accordance with the anticipated values. The chemical compositions of the Na 0.76Cu 0.22Fe 0.30Mn 0.48O 2 nano‐necklaces have also been investigated by XPS, no peaks other than Na, Cu, Fe, Mn, and O elements appear in the survey spectrum (Figure S6, Supporting Information), indicating the high purity of the product. In addition, N 2 adsorption–desorption measurement was conducted on the Na 0.76Cu 0.22Fe 0.30Mn 0.48O 2 sample (Figure S7, Supporting Information), displaying a typical type‐IV behavior with an obvious hysteresis loop at relative pressure ( P/ P 0) ranging from 0.5 to 1.0. Correspondingly, the specific surface area is 66.58 m 2 g −1 calculated from the Brunauere–Emmette–Teller method, and the Barrette–Joynere–Halenda pore sizes are between 2 and 20 nm.
